excerpt.rendered: Civil society experts from Africa and Europe are invited to share their views ahead of the 2024 Commonwealth People’s Forum in Samoa.

yoast_head_json.og_description: Civil society experts from Africa and Europe are invited to share their views ahead of the 2024 Commonwealth People's Forum in Samoa.

@graph.name: Regional Conversation: Africa and Europe - FundFinity Grants

@graph.caption: ESILALEI, TANZANIA - FEBRUARY 2, 2014: Through the creation of solar powered micro-grids, Maasai of the Moduli district in northern Tanzania are receiving power in their mud huts inside their bomas (corralled community). The solar power is providing life-saving water purification, a shared refrigerator for food and medicines, a computer for the community, and lights for the cow and goat corrals to frighten away the hyenas. The International Collaborative for Science, Education and the Environment (ICSEE) also manufactures and distributes a chimney stove for Maasai homes designed collaboratively with Maasai women and installed by teams of women from each participating village to reduce the intake of smoke and carbon dioxide when cooking over traditional fires inside the home. Photo by Morgana Wingard
